intro: Heliotropium bovei, commonly known as the velvetleaf heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of small, fragrant purple or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. Its flowers open in response to sunlight, a trait known as heliotropism.
